snippet: Tax evasion lies at the heart of the Greek financial collapse, yet efforts to collect billions of euros in taxes from deadbeat residents have yielded little additional revenue.
abstract: Efforts to collect billions of euros in taxes from deadbeat residents have yielded little additional revenue for Greece; tax evasion lies at heart of Greek financial collapse, which has resulted in international bailout loans exceeding 205 billion euros, or $266 billion.

byline.original: By LANDON THOMAS Jr. and ELENI VARVITSIOTI

lead_paragraph: Tax evasion lies at the heart of the Greek financial collapse, yet efforts to collect billions of euros in taxes from deadbeat residents have yielded little additional revenue.

headline.seo: Greek Tax Crackdown Yields Little Revenue
headline.main: Greek Crackdown on Tax Evasion Yields Little Revenue
headline.print_headline: Greek Crackdown on Tax Evasion Yields Little Revenue in Tackling the Deficit
